item.title: Microsoft Rolls Out Default NTLM Relay Attack Mitigations
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Microsoft has rolled out new default security protections that mitigate NTLM relaying attacks across on-premises Exchange, AD CS, and LDAP services.

The post Microsoft Rolls Out Default NTLM Relay Attack Mitigations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 9, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 9, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: $50 Million Radiant Capital Heist Blamed on North Korean Hackers
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Radiant Capital says a North Korean threat actor stole $50 million in assets in a sophisticated October attack.

The post $50 Million Radiant Capital Heist Blamed on North Korean Hackers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical OpenWrt Flaw Exposes Firmware Update Server to Exploitation
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The CVE-2024-54143 vulnerability affects the OpenWrt sysupgrade server and exposes users to risks of installing malicious firmware images.

The post Critical OpenWrt Flaw Exposes Firmware Update Server to Exploitation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Medical Device Maker Artivion Scrambling to Restore Systems After Ransomware Attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Medical devices manufacturer Artivion says a ransomware attack caused disruptions to order and shipping processes.

The post Medical Device Maker Artivion Scrambling to Restore Systems After Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: QNAP Patches Vulnerabilities Exploited at Pwn2Own
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
QNAP has released patches for multiple high-severity QTS and QuTS Hero vulnerabilities disclosed at the Pwn2Own Ireland 2024 hacking contest.

The post QNAP Patches Vulnerabilities Exploited at Pwn2Own appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Blue Yonder Probing Data Theft Claims After Ransomware Gang Takes Credit for Attack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The Blue Yonder ransomware attack that caused disruptions to Starbucks and major grocery stores may have also involved information theft.

The post Blue Yonder Probing Data Theft Claims After Ransomware Gang Takes Credit for Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Deloitte Responds After Ransomware Group Claims Data Theft
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Deloitte has issued a response after the Brain Cipher ransomware group claimed to have stolen over 1 Tb of information belonging to the company.

The post Deloitte Responds After Ransomware Group Claims Data Theft appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Eight Suspected Phishers Arrested in Belgium, Netherlands
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Belgian and Dutch authorities arrested eight individuals for their alleged involvement in phishing, online scams, and money laundering operations.

The post Eight Suspected Phishers Arrested in Belgium, Netherlands appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Anna Jaques Hospital Data Breach Impacts 316,000 People
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Anna Jaques Hospital says the personal information of over 316,000 individuals was compromised in a year-old data breach.

The post Anna Jaques Hospital Data Breach Impacts 316,000 People appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The EU Makes an Urgent TikTok Inquiry on Russia’s Role in Romanian Election Turmoil
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
EU sent TikTok an urgent request for more information about Romanian intelligence files suggesting that Russia coordinated influencers to promote a candidate who became the surprise front-runner in presidential election.

The post The EU Makes an Urgent TikTok Inquiry on Russia’s Role in Romanian Election Turmoil appeared first on SecurityWeek.
